description.narrative: GF C19RM 2021 - The goal is to decrease mortality and morbidity related to COVID in Guinea Bissau and to support the health system to respond to the pandemic.

participating-org.narrative: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
TAR - The Global Fund to Fight

provider-org.narrative: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
TAR - The Global Fund to Fight

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
This project addresses the third SDG: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages.
More specifically, it responds to following indicator from the Global Indicator Framework: 3.3 By 2030, end the epidemics of AIDS, tuberculosis, malaria and neglected tropical diseases and combat hepatitis, water-borne diseases and other communicable diseases
3.3.3 Malaria incidence per 1,000 population
Output Indicators 1.1 proportion of the population at risk potentially covered by the distribution of long-lasting insecticide-treated mosquito nets 1.2 Number of long-lasting insecticide-treated nets distributed continuously to target risk groups 1.3 Proportion of targeted risk groups receiving long-lasting insecticide-treated mosquito nets 1.4 Proportion of outbreaks in targeted areas that benefited from indoor residual spraying during the reporting period 2.1 Proportion of suspected malaria cases tested for parasitological testing in public sector health facilities 2.2 Proportion of suspected cases of malaria subjected to parasitological testing in the community 2.3 Proportion of suspected cases of malaria subjected to parasitological testing in private sector premises 3.1 Proportion of confirmed malaria cases receiving first-line antimalarial treatment in accordance with national policy in public sector health facilities 3.2 Proportion of confirmed malaria cases receiving first-line antimalarial treatment in accordance with national policy in the community 3.3 Proportion of confirmed malaria cases receiving first-line antimalarial treatment, in accordance with national policy, in private sector premises 3.4 Proportion of estimated malaria cases (suspected and confirmed) receiving first-line antimalarial treatment in public sector health facilities 3.5 Proportion of estimated malaria cases (suspected and confirmed) receiving first-line antimalarial treatment in the community 3.6 Proportion of estimated malaria cases (suspected and confirmed) receivin

SPI-1: Proportion of pregnant women attending antenatal clinics who received three or more doses of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria -10.2%
SPI-2: Percentage of children aged 3–59 months who received the full number of courses of SMC (3 or 4) per transmission season in the targeted areas -84.6%
M&E-2: Proportion of facility reports received over the reports expected during the reporting period -78.5%
CM-4: Proportion of health facilities without stock-outs of key commodities during the reporting period -90.8
